labels.analysis: The MCP Server is focused on text generation and writing enhancement using language models. Its primary tools allow users to list available models, generate text from direct input, file content, or URL content. This indicates a strong emphasis on content creation, automation of text-based tasks, and leveraging AI for writing assistance.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Content Creation" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around generating and enhancing text, which is central to content creation. The "AI/ML Tools" label is appropriate as the server leverages language models for its text generation capabilities. No custom label is needed as the functionality fits well within predefined categories.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Spiral Writing Tool
server_info_crawled.author: @jxnl/spiral-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Interact with Spiral's language models to generate text from various input sources. Utilize powerful tools for model listing, text generation, and article extraction to enhance your writing capabilities.

tools.name: list_models
tools.description: Deploy Server Spiral Writing Tool Claim Server @jxnl/spiral-mcp Try in Playground list_models

tools.name: generate
tools.description: Generate text using a Spiral model.

tools.name: generate_from_file
tools.description: Generate text using a Spiral model with input from a file.

tools.name: generate_from_url
tools.description: Generate text using a Spiral model with input from a URL.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@jxnl/spiral-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
